subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Jesus having loved His own which were in the world, loved them unto the end." (John 13:1b)
reflection: Jesus knew He would be betrayed by one of His disciples, denied by another, and deserted by all of them for a time. Still He now showed the disciples the full extent of His love. God also knows us completely, as Jesus knew His disciples (2:24, 25:6:64). He knows the sins we have committed and the ones we will yet commit. Still, He loves us. How do you respond to that kind of love???
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to have a Christ-like love. Help me to have a loving-heart for others and a willingness to obey Your commandments. Amen.
original_content:
08/03/09~~~food for thought~~~Give one good reason why we should not 
be model servants of Christ...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Jesus having loved His own which were in the world,
loved them unto the end." (Jn. 13:1b)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus knew He would be betrayed by one of His disciples, 
denied by another, and deserted by all of them for a time...

Still He now showed the disciples the full extent of His love...

God also knows us completely, as Jesus knew His disciples
(2:24, 25: 6:64)...

He knows the sins we have committed and the ones we will
yet commit. Still, He loves us...

How do you respond to that kind of love???

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to have a Christ-like love.
Help me to have a loving-heart for others and a willingness
to obey Your commandments...Amen. 

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is actually best for you that I go away, because if I don't, the Counselor won't come. If I do go away, He will come because I will send Him to you... And when He comes, He will convince the world of its sin, and of God's righteousness, and the coming judgment...(John 16:7, 8)
reflection: We need to remember, that unless Jesus did what He came to do, there would be no Good News. If He did not die, He would not remove our sins; He could not rise again and defeat death. If He did not go back to the Father the Holy Spirit would not come. Christ's presence on earth was limited to one place at a time. His leaving meant He could be present to the whole world through the Holy Spirit. There are three important task of the Holy Spirit: (1) Convincing the world of its sin and calling it to repentance, (2) Revealing the standard of God's righteousness to anyone who believes, because Christ would no longer be physically present on earth, and (3) Demonstrating Christ's judgment over Satan.
prayer: Lord, help us to be ever sensitive to Your Spirit's working in our heart, so that we would not sin against You. Help us to make this one aim of our desire and prayer. Amen.
original_content:
089/10/09~~~food for thought~~~Remember according to Jesus, not believing
in Him is sin...

Our Bible Verses for Today: (words from Jesus)
"It is actually best for you that I go away, because if I don't, 
the Counselor won't come. If I do go away, He will come
because I will send Him to you...

And when He comes, He will convince the world of its sin,
and of God's righteousness, and the coming judgment...(Jn. 16:7, 8)

Our Lesson for Today:
We need to remember, that unless Jesus did what He came to do, 
there would be no Good News. If He did not die, He would not remove 
our sins; He could not rise again and defeat death...

If He did not go back to the Father the Holy Spirit would not come.
Christ's presence on earth was limited to one place at a time...

His leaving meant He could be present to the whole world through
the Holy Spirit...

There are three important task of the Holy Spirit:

(1) Convincing the world of its sin and calling it to repentance,
(2) Revealing the standard of God's righteousness to anyone 
who believes, because Christ would no longer be physically 
present on earth, and
(3) Demonstrating Christ's judgment over Satan...

Prayer Suggestion:
Lord, help us to be ever sensitive to Your Spirit's working in our 
heart, so that we would not sin against You...Help us to make this 
one aim of our desire and prayer...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: From the time the earth was created, people have seen the earth and sky and all that God made. They can clearly see His invisible qualities ~ His eternal power and divine nature. So they have no excuse whatsoever for not knowing God. (Romans 1:20)
reflection: What kind of God does nature reveal??? Nature shows us a God of might, intelligence, and intricate detail; a God of order and beauty; a God who controls powerful forces. That is general revelation. Through special revelation (the Bible and the coming of Jesus), we learn about God's love and forgiveness and the promise of eternal life. But knowing God exists is not enough. People must learn that God is loving and that He sent His Son to demonstrate His love for us (5:8). People must be shown how to accept God's forgiveness of their sins. (Romans 10:14, 15) Yes God has graciously given us many sources that we might come to believe in Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, create within me a deep desire to learn more about You. Let this be my one desire and continual prayer ~ the life and the love of You living in my heart. Amen.
original_content:
08/17/09~~~food for thought~~~How much more does God have to do
to prove He loves us???

Our Bible Verse for Today:
From the time the earth was created, people have seen the
earth and sky and all that God made. They can clearly see 
His invisible qualities ~ His eternal power and divine nature.
So they have no excuse whatsoever for not knowing God...(Ro. 1:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
What kind of God does nature reveal???

Nature shows us a God of might, intelligence, and intricate detail;
a God of order and beauty; a God who controls powerful forces...

That is general revelation. Through special revelation (the Bible and
the coming of Jesus), we learn about God's love and forgiveness and
the promise of eternal life...

But knowing God exists is not enough. People must learn that God is
loving and that He sent His Son to demonstrate His love for us (5:8).

People must be shown how to accept God's forgiveness of their sins. 
(Ro. 10:14, 15)

Yes God has graciously given us many sources that we might come to
believe in Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, create within me a deep desire to 
learn more about You. Let this be my one desire
and continual prayer ~ the life and the love of You
living in my heart...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Surely I have a delightful inheritance. (Psalms 16:6)
reflection: A pastor stopped to visit a wealthy man in the area. He proudly said to the pastor, "All this is mine, " as he was giving the pastor a tour of his farm. Everything as far as the eye could see was his. The pastor quietly asked, "Is Jesus yours." Good question, Is Jesus mine? Can I say with the psalmist, "Surely I have a delightful inheritance"? Nothing in this world can top the treasures God offers me in the Savor. When the dollars and cents are lined up against the precious blood of Jesus that paid for my sins, how short they seem. When the buildings and holdings of this life are placed on the scales, how light they weigh in contrast to the pardon and peace Christ brings me with the heavenly Father. The question still remains, "Is Jesus mine?" That little word mine is so important. What good is an inheritance if our name isn't on it? Or what good is an inheritance if we do not claim it? Thank God if He has opened the hand of faith for you to claim the riches Jesus has prepared for you. Pray each day that God would open your hand of faith and wrap it around such a delightful inheritance.
prayer: Thank you Lord, for the gift of Jesus and all He brings. Help me keep my faith in Him always. Amen.
original_content:
08/24/09~~~food for thought~~~What will my eternal inheritance be?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Surely I have a delightful inheritance...(Ps. 16:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
A pastor stopped to visit a wealthy man in the area. He proudly said to 
the pastor, "All this is mine," as he was giving the pastor a tour of his farm. 
Everything as far as the eye could see was his...

The pastor quietly asked, "Is Jesus yours."

Good question, Is Jesus mine? Can I say with the psalmist, "Surely I 
have a delightful inheritance"?

Nothing in this world can top the treasures God offers me in the Savor.
When the dollars and cents are lined up against the precious blood of 
Jesus that paid for my sins, how short they seem...

When the buildings and holdings of this life are placed on the scales,
how light they weigh in contrast to the pardon and peace Christ brings
me with the heavenly Father...

The question still remains, "Is Jesus mine?" That little word mine is
so important. What good is an inheritance if our name isn't on it?
Or what good is an inheritance if we do not claim it?

Thank God if He has opened the hand of faith for you to claim the
riches Jesus has prepared for you. Pray each day that God would
open your hand of faith and wrap it around such a delightful inheritance...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank you Lord, for the gift of Jesus and all He brings.
Help me keep my faith in Him always...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If righteousness could be gained through the law, Christ died for nothing! (Galatians 2:21)
reflection: People today seem to be continually looking for a substitution for one thing or another, even when it comes to their salvation. One of Satan's most effective attacks against Christianity is deceiving people into thinking they can substitute for Christ's work of salvation. When people look to their own efforts to satisfy their hunger for heaven, Satan has them in his grasp and heads for hell. Jesus said of sin's payment on the cross, "It is finished." The sinner mistakenly says, "I must add something with my own works." Jesus says to the penitent sinner."Go in peace." The sinner foolishly says, "How can I have peace when I don't know whether my works have done enough to save me?" Jesus says to the dying believer, "Today you'll be with Me in heaven." The sinner anxiously worries, "Are my efforts sufficient to help hold open heaven's door?" This is why Paul insists."If I try to substitute my own works fully or in part for Christ's completed work of Salvation, then Christ died for nothing."
prayer: Dear Lord, preserve me from such fatal false thinking. Cement my faith on Jesus' work alone. Amen.
original_content:
08/26/09~~~food for thought~~~There can be no substitution for Christ...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
If righteousness could be gained through the law,
Christ died for nothing! (Gal. 2:21)

Our Lesson for Today:
People today seem to be continually looking for a substitution for one 
thing or another, even when it comes to their salvation...

One of Satan's most effective attacks against Christianity is deceiving
people into thinking they can substitute for Christ's work of salvation...

When people look to their own efforts to satisfy their hunger for heaven, 
Satan has them in his grasp and heads for hell...

Jesus said of sin's payment on the cross, "It is finished."

The sinner mistakenly says, "I must add something with my own works."

Jesus says to the penitent sinner."Go in peace."

The sinner foolishly says, "How can I have peace when I don't know
whether my works have done enough to save me?"

Jesus says to the dying believer, "Today you'll be with Me in heaven."

The sinner anxiously worries, "Are my efforts sufficient to help hold open
heaven's door?"

This is why Paul insists."If I try to substitute my own works fully or in part for
Christ's completed work of Salvation, then Christ died for nothing."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, preserve me from such fatal false thinking.
Cement my faith on Jesus' work alone...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You forgave the iniquity of your people and covered all their sins. (Psalms 85:2)
reflection: Each of our sins are like some hideous scar on our soul. It makes us ugly in the sight of a holy God. Not only does God dislike what we look like, but He also has to banish us from His presence forever in that horrible place called hell. But our gracious God came up with a solution. He asked His Son to take care of sin's horrible scars. On the cross of Calvary, Jesus gave His all in payment for all sin. He didn't just hide them with His hand. He did radical surgery on them. Yes this surgeon comes to each of us through His Word and offers forgiveness to us. He even works faith in us so we can call Him our Savior. Do you have any scars that our holy God will not tolerate, remember He wants to remove them, all we have to do is ask Him to.
prayer: Thank You Lord for removing my sins through Jesus' work. Cover me with His forgiveness so I can stand in beauty before You. Amen.
original_content:
08/28/09~~~food for thought~~~If you ask Jesus into your heart sin's
blemish will be removed...

You forgave the iniquity of your people and covered
all their sins...(Ps. 85:2)

It makes us ugly in the sight of a holy God...

place called hell...

But our gracious God came up with a solution...

He asked His Son to take care of sin's horrible scars.
On the cross of Calvary, Jesus gave His all in payment
for all sin. He didn't just hide them with His hand. He did

Yes this surgeon comes to each of us through His Word and
offers forgiveness to us. He even works faith in us so we can 
call Him our Savior...

Do you have any scars that our holy God will not tolerate, remember
He wants to remove them, all we have to do is ask Him to...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You Lord for removing my sins through Jesus' work. 
Cover me with His forgiveness so I can stand in beauty
before You...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus Himself bore our sins in His body on the tree. By His wounds you have been healed. (I Peter 2:24)
reflection: When the church's roof was redone, the contractor discovered that the lightning rods hadn't been properly installed. The rods stood there with heavy wires running down, but they were not attached to anything on the lawn below. So the ground could not absorb the charge which never reached it. The lightning of God's just anger over sin had to strike. That's what justice means. If His anger were to hit sinners, they'd be fried to a crisp in the fires of hell. So God in His love provided a lightning rod system for us, He deflected the punishment for sin from us to Jesus. How foolish for unbelievers to think they can ground God's lightning strikes for sin! How blessed are those who are connected by faith's wire to Jesus!
prayer: Dear Lord, Keep me connected to Jesus so that I can stand safely in heaven before You. Amen.
original_content:
08/29/09~~~food for thought~~~If you have become disconnect from Jesus
reconnect today, a sin may be waiting to strike
at any moment...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus Himself bore our sins in His body on the tree...
By His wounds you have been healed...(I Pet. 2:24)

Our Lesson for Today:
When the church's roof was redone, the contractor discovered 
that the lightning rods hadn't been properly installed. The rods
stood there with heavy wires running down, but they were not attached 
to anything on the lawn below. So the ground could not absorb
the charge which never reached it...

The lightning of God's just anger over sin had to strike. That's what 
justice means. If His anger were to hit sinners, they'd be fried to a 
crisp in the fires of hell...

So God in His love provided a lightning rod system for us, He
deflected the punishment for sin from us to Jesus...

How foolish for unbelievers to think they can ground God's

by faith's wire to Jesus!

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Keep me connected to Jesus so that I
can stand safely in heaven before You...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Is not my Word like fire, " Declares the Lord, "and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?" (Jeremiah 23:29)
reflection: What do you do with a hammer? ~~~ It depends doesn't it? You can use it to tear down ~~~ or to build up? When walls need replacement, first you hammer away at the old. When its knocked down, you pound into place the new. Its the same with fire ~~~ you can use it to destroy debris or to ignite a jet engine. Have you ever thought about God's Word as a hammer or a fire? Like some hammer it pounds away the sin-hardened heart. Nothing but the force of God's gospel can make a dent in an unbeliever's heart. Only its mighty blows can tear down the unbelief that rules in the sinful heart inherited from our parents ~~~ Like some fire God's gospel reduces to ashes the self -righteousness that packs the human heart. Only the gospel's purifying flames get rid of the human instinct to earn one's own salvation. So let us not use God's Word like some unused tool on the workbench of life ~~~ Lets reach for this hammer and fire regularly.
prayer: Dear Lord, keep using You Word as a hammer and fire on me. Amen.
original_content:
08/30/09~~~food for thought~~~There is only one place to seek Godly wisdom ~~~
via God's Word...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Is not my Word like fire," Declares the Lord, "and like a 
hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?" (Jer. 23:29)

Our Lesson for Today:
What do you do with a hammer? ~~~ It depends doesn't it?

You can use it to tear down ~~~ or to build up?

When walls need replacement, first you hammer away at the old.
When its knocked down, you pound into place the new...

Its the same with fire ~~~ you can use it to destroy debris or to
ignite a jet engine...

Have you ever thought about God's Word as a hammer or a fire?

Like some hammer it pounds away the sin-hardened heart. Nothing
but the force of God's gospel can make a dent in an unbeliever's 
heart...

Only its mighty blows can tear down the unbelief that rules in the
sinful heart inherited from our parents ~~~ Like some fire God's 
gospel reduces to ashes the self -righteousness that packs the 
human heart...

Only the gospel's purifying flames get rid of the human instinct to
earn one's own salvation...

So let us not use God's Word like some unused tool on the 
workbench of life ~~~ Lets reach for this hammer and fire regularly...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, keep using You Word as a hammer and fire on me...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
reflection: In 1844, the inventor Samuel Morse sent a message by telegraph from Baltimore to Washington. His message contained only four words: "What hath God wrought!" (KJV. ) That successful demonstration sold his invention, and news-gathering agencies turned to its use. Today its satellite television and cellular phones, now we have to go to a museum to learn about Morse's invention. There is no replacement for the telegraph God uses to transmit His message to us. Just as to the generations before and after us, God speaks through His Word. Oh yes, the methods used to carry His Word may change. In the future, who knows what means might pop up? And we'll thank God even as we try to harness those means to get His Word out. But the message will still be the same. It'll still be, "See what God has done." It will point at the sinner with the chilling reminder of Gods law ~ what man has done can only doom him. Then it will point to God with the saving revelation of God's gospel ~ what Jesus has done is more than enough to save the sinner."See what God has done in His enduring love to ready that sinner for heaven." For that timeless message there can never be a replacement.
prayer: Dear Lord, through Your Word let me hear You telling me what You have done to save me. Amen.
original_content:
08/31/09~~~food for thought~~~What Jesus has done for us is more than enough!

Our Bible Verse for Today:
See what God has done! (Num. 23:23b)

Our Lesson for Today:
In 1844, the inventor Samuel Morse sent a message by telegraph
from Baltimore to Washington. His message contained only four
words: "What hath God wrought!" (KJV.)

That successful demonstration sold his invention, and news-gathering 
agencies turned to its use...

Today its satellite television and cellular phones, now we have to go
to a museum to learn about Morse's invention...

There is no replacement for the telegraph God uses to transmit His
message to us. Just as to the generations before and after us, God
speaks through His Word...

Oh yes, the methods used to carry His Word may change. In the future,
who knows what means might pop up? And we'll thank God even as we
try to harness those means to get His Word out...

But the message will still be the same. It'll still be, "See what God has done."

It will point at the sinner with the chilling reminder of Gods law ~ what man 
has done can only doom him...

Then it will point to God with the saving revelation of God's gospel ~ what 
Jesus has done is more than enough to save the sinner...

"See what God has done in His enduring love to ready that sinner for heaven."

For that timeless message there can never be a replacement...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, through Your Word let me hear You telling
me what You have done to save me...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Repent (turn from your sins) and believe the good news." (Mark 1:15)
reflection: Repentance is not merely mouthing the words "I"m sorry." Sometimes those words mean "I'm sorry that I got caught." "I'm sorry that I am being punished." "I'll be more careful next time so that I get away with it." Or they can mean "I truly feel bad that I hurt you and I will not do it again." The repentance which Jesus calls us to, is far more than a superficial feeling. The word Jesus uses means a change of heart. Like with the cheating tax collector Zacchaeus. Repentance means admitting our sins, recognizing the hurt we have caused to our neighbor and Jesus, then making amends for those sins, and then fighting against them, (or turning from them). We need to understand the connect between repentance and salvation. It is only those who truly repent of their sins that will find in the gospel the good news they need. To those who don't feel their sins, repentance is only a term, not a treasure. Before we can enjoy Jesus' forgiveness, we need to understand His call to repentance.
prayer: Dear Lord, change my heart by bringing me to repentance so I might treasure Your forgiveness. Amen.
original_content:
09/01/08~~~food for thought~~~A 'pure heart' is only accomplished through 
continuous prayer...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Repent (turn from your sins) and believe the good news." (Mk. 1:15)

Our Lesson for Today:
Repentance is not merely mouthing the words "I"m sorry."
Sometimes those words mean "I'm sorry that I got caught."
"I'm sorry that I am being punished."
"I'll be more careful next time so that I get away with it."
Or they can mean "I truly feel bad that I hurt you and I will not do it again."

The repentance which Jesus calls us to, is far more than a superficial feeling.
The word Jesus uses means a change of heart. Like with the cheating tax
collector Zacchaeus. 

Repentance means admitting our sins, recognizing the hurt we have caused
to our neighbor and Jesus, then making amends for those sins, and then fighting 
against them, (or turning from them)...

We need to understand the connect between repentance and salvation.

It is only those who truly repent of their sins that will find in the gospel the 
good news they need...

To those who don't feel their sins, repentance is only a term, not a treasure.
Before we can enjoy Jesus' forgiveness, we need to understand His call to 
repentance...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, change my heart by bringing me to repentance
so I might treasure Your forgiveness...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
